columns.text: In this problem, we will determine how the marginal personal tax rate and the marginal tax rate on capital gains affects the share price.

This problem considers two marginal tax rates. The marginal tax rate refers to the tax rate that is paid for ever additional dollar earned. This means that the marginal personal tax rate $\text{T}_P$ is the marginal tax rate on personal gains and the marginal tax rate on capital gains $\text{T}_G$ is the marginal tax rate for the gains earned in selling stocks.

**c.)** For this case, we will assume that the marginal personal tax rate is still $15\%$ but the marginal tax rate on capital gains is $30\%$. Substituting these will give us:

$$\begin{aligned}
\dfrac{(\text{P}_O-\text{P}_x)}{\text{D}}&=\dfrac{1-0.15}{1-0.30}\\[15 pt]
\dfrac{(\text{P}_O-\text{P}_x)}{\text{D}}&=\dfrac{0.85}{0.70}\times\text{D}\\[15 pt]
\text{P}_O-\text{P}_x&=1.21\times\text{D}
\end{aligned}$$

This means that the price change will be $121\%$ of the declared dividends.

**d.)** In this case, both marginal tax rates are at $35\%$. However, since the owner of the stocks are corporations, they are entitled to a $50\%$ discount on their marginal personal tax rate.

This gives us a marginal personal tax rate of:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{T}_P&=0.50\times0.35\\
&=0.175
\end{aligned}$$

This means that the marginal personal tax rate is $17.5\%$

Substituting these to the formula, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\dfrac{(\text{P}_O-\text{P}_x)}{\text{D}}&=\dfrac{1-0.175}{1-0.35}\\[15 pt]
\dfrac{(\text{P}_O-\text{P}_x)}{\text{D}}&=\dfrac{0.825}{0.65}\times\text{D}\\[15 pt]
\text{P}_O-\text{P}_x&=1.27\times\text{D}
\end{aligned}$$

This means that the change in share price is equal to $127\%$ of the declared dividend.

**e.)** Based on the calculations above, the dividend of the firm directly affects the change in share price and vice versa. The change is also directed by the two marginal tax rates. The marginal personal tax rate, when increased, will decrease the change in share price. On the other hand, an increase in the marginal tax rate on capital gains will result in an increase in the share price of the company's stock only if the marginal tax rate on capital gains is higher than the marginal personal tax rate.
